detectors.description: Detects incorrect assumptions about transient storage persisting across transactions

detectors.name: EIP-1153 Callback Manipulation
detectors.description: Detects transient storage state that can be manipulated during external callbacks

detectors.name: EIP-1153 Composability Risk
detectors.description: Detects transient storage slot collisions when multiple contracts use transient storage without proper namespacing

detectors.name: EIP-1153 Guard Bypass
detectors.description: Detects flawed implementations of reentrancy guards using transient storage that can be bypassed

detectors.name: Sandwich Conditional Swap
detectors.description: Detects conditional swap patterns vulnerable to sophisticated sandwich attacks with conditional execution

detectors.name: JIT Liquidity Extraction
detectors.description: Detects just-in-time liquidity patterns where MEV searchers can extract value through liquidity manipulation

detectors.name: Backrunning Opportunity
detectors.description: Detects state changes that can be profitably backrun by MEV searchers

detectors.name: Bundle Inclusion Leak
detectors.description: Detects information leakage patterns that could reveal bundle contents to attackers

detectors.name: Order Flow Auction Abuse
detectors.description: Detects order flow auction patterns vulnerable to manipulation where searchers can game the auction mechanism

detectors.name: Encrypted Mempool Timing Attack
detectors.description: Detects timing vulnerabilities in encrypted mempool or commit-reveal implementations where transaction timing can leak information

detectors.name: Cross-Domain MEV
detectors.description: Detects MEV extraction opportunities across L1/L2 boundaries or between different rollups where timing differences enable arbitrage

detectors.name: Liquidation MEV
detectors.description: Detects liquidation patterns vulnerable to MEV extraction where searchers can front-run liquidations or manipulate prices to trigger profitable liquidations

detectors.name: Oracle Update MEV
detectors.description: Detects oracle update patterns vulnerable to front-running where searchers can profit by trading before price updates

detectors.name: Governance Proposal MEV
detectors.description: Detects governance proposal patterns vulnerable to front-running where attackers can submit counter-proposals or acquire voting power before proposal execution

detectors.name: Token Launch MEV
detectors.description: Detects token launch patterns vulnerable to sniping where MEV bots can front-run initial liquidity to buy tokens at launch price

detectors.name: NFT Mint MEV
detectors.description: Detects NFT mint patterns vulnerable to front-running where MEV bots can snipe rare tokens or front-run popular mints

detectors.name: Metamorphic Contract Risk
detectors.description: Detects CREATE2 + SELFDESTRUCT patterns enabling bytecode mutation at the same address

detectors.name: CREATE2 Salt Front-running
detectors.description: Detects predictable CREATE2 salts enabling deployment front-running attacks

detectors.name: CREATE2 Address Collision
detectors.description: Detects intentional address reuse after destruction for code substitution attacks

detectors.name: EXTCODESIZE Check Bypass
detectors.description: Detects EXTCODESIZE checks that can be bypassed during contract construction when code size is 0

detectors.name: Selfdestruct Recipient Control
detectors.description: Detects selfdestruct operations where the recipient address can be controlled by users, enabling fund theft

detectors.name: Contract Recreation Attack
detectors.description: Detects patterns where contracts can be recreated at the same address with different code after destruction

detectors.name: Constructor Reentrancy
detectors.description: Detects external calls in constructors that can enable reentrancy before security mechanisms are fully initialized

detectors.name: Initcode Injection
detectors.description: Detects CREATE2 deployments where initcode can be controlled or manipulated by attackers to deploy malicious contracts

detectors.name: Nested Callback Reentrancy
detectors.description: Detects nested safe callbacks that can enable state corruption through chained reentrancy attacks

detectors.name: Callback In Callback Loop
detectors.description: Detects recursive callback patterns that can be exploited through looped callback invocations leading to stack exhaustion or reentrancy

detectors.name: Multicall msg.value Reuse
detectors.description: Detects multicall/batch operations where msg.value can be reused across multiple calls, enabling ETH double-spending attacks

detectors.name: Multicall Partial Revert
detectors.description: Detects multicall/batch operations where partial success can cause inconsistent state due to improper error handling

detectors.name: Batch Cross-Function Reentrancy
detectors.description: Detects reentrancy vulnerabilities between functions called within a multicall/batch operation

detectors.name: Flash Callback Manipulation
detectors.description: Detects flash loan callback patterns vulnerable to state manipulation through TOCTOU attacks

detectors.name: ERC721 SafeMint Callback
detectors.description: Detects ERC721 safeMint patterns vulnerable to callback exploitation through onERC721Received reentrancy attacks

detectors.name: ERC1155 Callback Reentrancy
detectors.description: Detects ERC1155 callback patterns vulnerable to reentrancy through onERC1155Received and onERC1155BatchReceived callbacks

detectors.name: Uniswap V4 Hook Callback
detectors.description: Detects Uniswap V4 hook patterns vulnerable to callback exploitation, state manipulation, and reentrancy attacks

detectors.name: Compound Callback Chain
detectors.description: Detects Compound-style lending protocol callback chain vulnerabilities through cToken interactions and market manipulation

detectors.name: Governance Parameter Bypass
detectors.description: Detects governance parameters that can be changed before timelock restrictions apply, enabling admins to bypass governance controls

detectors.name: Voting Snapshot Manipulation
detectors.description: Detects voting systems where snapshots can be taken after token acquisition or delegation, enabling flash loan voting attacks

detectors.name: Quorum Calculation Overflow
detectors.description: Detects quorum calculations vulnerable to overflow or reentrancy attacks that can over-count votes and bypass quorum requirements

detectors.name: Proposal Front-running
detectors.description: Detects governance systems vulnerable to proposal front-running where attackers can submit counter-proposals in the same block

detectors.name: Governor Refund Drain
detectors.description: Detects governance systems where refund parameters can be changed to drain the treasury through excessive gas refunds or bounties

detectors.name: Timelock Bypass via Delegatecall
detectors.description: Detects patterns where timelock restrictions can be bypassed by routing calls through proxy contracts with delegatecall

detectors.name: Role Escalation via Upgrade
detectors.description: Detects upgrade patterns where new implementation constructors can grant elevated privileges, bypassing access control

detectors.name: Access Control Race Condition
detectors.description: Detects access control patterns vulnerable to race conditions where concurrent grant/revoke operations can lead to privilege confusion

detectors.name: Operator Whitelist Inheritance
detectors.description: Detects upgradeable contracts where operator approvals may persist after upgrades, granting unintended access to previous operators

detectors.name: Cross-Contract Role Confusion
detectors.description: Detects access control patterns where roles defined in one contract are mistakenly used for authorization in another contract

detectors.name: Sequencer Fee Exploitation
detectors.description: Detects L2 sequencer fee model exploitation for MEV extraction

detectors.name: Escape Hatch Dependency
detectors.description: Detects over-reliance on L1 escape mechanisms in L2 contracts

detectors.name: Cross-L2 Frontrunning
detectors.description: Detects race conditions between L2 finality and L1 confirmation

detectors.name: Optimistic Inference Attack
detectors.description: Detects state inference from partial commits in optimistic rollups

detectors.name: L2 MEV Sequencer Leak
detectors.description: Detects sequencer MEV extraction via transaction ordering on L2

detectors.name: DA Sampling Attack
detectors.description: Detects data availability under-sampling vulnerabilities

detectors.name: Bridge Merkle Bypass
detectors.description: Detects missing merkle proof validation in cross-chain bridges

detectors.name: Challenge Period Bypass
detectors.description: Detects premature withdrawal before challenge period expires in optimistic rollups

detectors.name: Cross-Rollup State Mismatch
detectors.description: Detects state inconsistency across rollups and chains

detectors.name: Blob Data Manipulation
detectors.description: Detects EIP-4844 blob data tampering without proper KZG verification

detectors.name: Blockhash Randomness
detectors.description: Detects weak randomness patterns using block.prevrandao, blockhash, or other block variables

detectors.name: Multi-Block Randomness
detectors.description: Detects patterns combining multiple block variables for randomness, which falsely appears more secure

detectors.name: Modulo Block Variable
detectors.description: Detects block.timestamp % N or block.number % N patterns used for random selection

detectors.name: Chainlink VRF Misuse
detectors.description: Detects improper Chainlink VRF integration patterns that could compromise randomness guarantees

detectors.name: Commit-Reveal Timing
detectors.description: Detects commit-reveal schemes with timing vulnerabilities such as insufficient delays or missing time bounds

detectors.name: DoS Push Pattern
detectors.description: Detects unbounded array growth via push operations that could lead to denial of service

detectors.name: DoS Unbounded Storage
detectors.description: Detects unbounded storage operations that can lead to denial of service through excessive gas costs

detectors.name: DoS External Call in Loop
detectors.description: Detects external calls within loops that can lead to denial of service if any recipient reverts

detectors.name: DoS Block Gas Limit
detectors.description: Detects operations that can exceed block gas limit, making functions impossible to execute

detectors.name: DoS Revert Bomb
detectors.description: Detects patterns vulnerable to revert bomb attacks where external contracts can force transaction failures

detectors.name: Missing Visibility Modifier
detectors.description: Detects state variables without explicit visibility modifiers
